errors.error_description: The command to run the introductory tutorial is syntactically incorrect. The `--tutorial` flag is not a valid way to call a tutorial.
correction_candidates: pip install marimo && marimo tutorial intro
pip install marimo && marimo run tutorial intro
pip install marimo && marimo --run-tutorial intro
pip install marimo && marimo start tutorial intro
errors.golden_answer: pip install marimo && marimo tutorial intro

errors.error_description: In the 'Learn more' section, the text refers to an `examples/notebooks/` folder, but the project's examples are located in the `examples/` directory at the root.
correction_candidates: Check out our [docs](https://docs.marimo.io), the `examples/` folder, and our [gallery](https://marimo.io/@public) to learn more.
Check out our [docs](https://docs.marimo.io), the `marimo/examples/` folder, and our [gallery](https://marimo.io/@public) to learn more.
Check out our [docs](https://docs.marimo.io), the `docs/examples/` folder, and our [gallery](https://marimo.io/@public) to learn more.
Check out our [docs](https://docs.marimo.io), the `tutorials/` folder, and our [gallery](https://marimo.io/@public) to learn more.
errors.golden_answer: Check out our [docs](https://docs.marimo.io), the `examples/` folder, and our [gallery](https://marimo.io/@public) to learn more.

errors.error_description: The URL for the main logotype image is incorrect. It points to a `master` branch, but the correct branch name is `main`, causing the image to fail to load.
correction_candidates: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/marimo-team/marimo/main/docs/_static/marimo-logotype-thick.svg
https://github.com/marimo-team/marimo/blob/main/docs/_static/marimo-logotype-thick.svg
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/marimo-team/marimo/main/docs/static/marimo-logotype-thick.svg
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/marimo-team/marimo/main/_static/marimo-logotype-thick.svg

errors.error_description: The installation instructions incorrectly state that marimo requires Python 3.6. According to its PyPI page, marimo requires Python 3.8 or newer.
correction_candidates: Remove the text '(requires Python 3.6):'
Change the text to '(requires Python 3.8+):'
Change the text to '(requires Python >= 3.8):'
Change the text to '(requires Python 3.7 or newer):'

errors.error_description: Fixed version specified in installation command that may be outdated or incompatible
correction_candidates: pip install marimo && marimo tutorial intro
pip install marimo>=0.2.5 && marimo tutorial intro
pip install --upgrade marimo && marimo tutorial intro
pip install marimo==latest && marimo tutorial intro
errors.golden_answer: pip install marimo && marimo tutorial intro

errors.error_description: Incorrect command 'marimo create' instead of 'marimo edit' for creating/editing notebooks
correction_candidates: marimo edit
marimo new
marimo start
marimo init

errors.error_description: Unnecessary dependencies (numpy, matplotlib, pandas) listed before marimo installation
correction_candidates: pip install marimo  # or conda install -c conda-forge marimo
pip install marimo numpy matplotlib pandas
pip install marimo[extras]
pip install marimo && pip install numpy matplotlib pandas
errors.golden_answer: pip install marimo  # or conda install -c conda-forge marimo
